intro: Ochna pulchra subsp. hoffmannii-ottonis, commonly known as Hoffmann’s ottonis, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces orange-red berries that are a source of food for birds and small mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
